haiku:
Faint afterglow sings
cosmic microwave background
Time’s baby photo

Quantum seeds tremble
Inflation stretched space wide fast
Smoothness blooms from noise

Night curves into math
Universe, vast and cold still
We count its quiet

large-scale structure forms
Filaments lace dark webs through
Clusters nod in time

Galaxies recede
Expansion writes red shift now
Metric stretches light

Void becomes a roar
From big bang, hot silence sprang
First seconds echo

Numbers in starlight
primordial abundance
Clues to first minutes

Pairs stop vanishing
At freeze out, rates fall away
Relics drift to now

Unseen gravity
dark matter hides in halos
Lenses bend, no glow

Weak whispers in flux
neutrinos ghost through suns bright
Mass tips the cosmos

Electroweak haze
sphalerons flip baryon counts
Symmetry leaks charge

Broken phases freeze
domain walls slice space-time thin
They must not survive

Cooling field chooses
Kibble mechanism births
Defects mark the choice

Small bumps in plasma
density perturbation
Become galaxies

Curvature goes mute
The flatness problem stares on
Inflation smooths it

Exponent stacks high
Count e-folds, clocks of growth fast
Horizon pulls in

After swift stretch ends
reheating floods fields with light
Thermal bath returns

Distant slices match
homogeneity holds
No favored address

Turn the sky around
isotropy sings out wide
Same glow in all ways

Old light cools to hush
cosmic microwave background
Seed specks on its face

Before atoms formed
inflation drove space huge fast
Flatness left behind

Between breathless voids
Universe keeps its own time
We measure, then stare

Galaxies in webs
large-scale structure emerges
Filaments, dark glue

Friedmann equations
chart the swelling metric, too
Curvature in ink

Time starts with a flare
big bang, then cooling oceans
Atoms learn to stay

Rates fall below H
freeze out locks relics in place
Comoving, they stay

Invisible mass
dark matter haunts lensing arcs
Weighs galaxies slow

Hot electroweak
sphalerons break B plus L
Washout, then freeze hard

Thin knots of old fields
cosmic strings tug at light paths
Loops hum, then decay

Cooling symmetry
Kibble mechanism seeds
Defects find their birth

Quantum ripples grow
density perturbation
Becomes clustered sky

Omega near one
flatness problem asks us why
Inflation answers

Log rulers for growth
e-folds count the doubling
Exponent's heartbeat

After inflation
reheating fills the cold void
Quanta wake again

Even fields stay calm
Cold homogeneity
No bump breaks the mold

Turn your gaze outward
In isotropy, all ways
Directions agree

Tiny ripples bloom
inflation flings space outward
Then seeds become stars

Night holds silent laws
Universe, wide and waking
We read its faint script

Galaxies in webs
Threaded large-scale structure grows
Dark scaffolds the void

Scale factor marches
Friedmann equations steer us
Time ticks, space obeys

Redder than before
expansion stretches the light
Distances unbind

Hot minutes make H
nucleosynthesis forged us
Helium forms fast

Ratios speak heat
primordial abundance
Deuterium, scarce

Scatters fade away
When freeze out locks the rate down
Relics drift through time

Invisible weight
dark matter holds galaxies
Bends light, stays unseen

Ghosts of the weak force
neutrinos stream through stone all
Hardly ever caught

Weak era at heat
sphalerons swap B and L
Asymmetry stays

Symmetry breaks fast
Kibble mechanism seeds
Defects freeze in place

Quantum jitter writes
density perturbation
Clumps grow, then collapse

Curvature should grow
The flatness problem lingers
Yet space stays near flat

Exponents pile up
Count e-folds, then horizons
Old woes fade away

Inflaton decays
reheating floods with quanta
Radiation comes

Fluids disagree
isocurvature modes
Phase shifts leave a trace

One smooth field of light
homogeneity holds
no lump, no favored

Turn, the sky stays same
isotropy in all ways
directions agree

Space swells in a blink
inflation flattens all scars
ripples seed the stars

Curvature meets dust
Friedmann equations now steer
Scale factor keeps beat

As the soup thins out
freeze out locks their last number
relics ride the void

Hidden mass tugs hard
dark matter shapes vast halos
seen by what it bends

Electroweak heat
sphalerons flip charges fast
when Higgs vev is nil

Symmetry breaks, leaves
domain walls trap false vacuum
too heavy, they'd win

Thin defects linger
cosmic strings lens distant light
split far images

Small density bumps
density perturbation
makes clusters, makes voids

Why is k so small
flatness problem still haunts us
until rapid swell

After silence, sparks
reheating floods with quanta
thermal baths restart

Afterglow of time
cosmic microwave background
Maps young heat ripples

Inflation stretches
Space swells faster than light once
Seeds quantum hush out

Universe unfolds
Curved and cooling, wide for us
From dark to dawn slow

Large-scale structure grows
Filaments lace voids through space
Galaxies in knots

Friedmann equations
Link scale factor to mass all
Time drives the curve home

Freeze out ends trade rates
As the cosmos thins and cools
Relics stay behind

Dark matter hides still
Shapes galaxy rotation
Seen only by pull

Neutrinos whisper
Through Earth they pass unscathed all
Ghost heat of the sun

Sphalerons unlock
Hot electroweak hops on
Baryon number leaks

Domain walls would loom
From broken phases, slabs form
We hunt their scars now

As symmetry breaks
Kibble mechanism forms
Defects get frozen

Small ripples grow slow
density perturbation
Clumps bloom into stars

Axions softly drift
They calm the theta angle
Cold field, unseen yet

Flatness problem asks
Why is space nearly flat now
Inflation smooths it

Count e-folds in time
Each grows the scale factor once
Exponent keeps score

Reheating begins
Inflaton decays to soup
Hot light comes back here

Galaxies repeat
homogeneity true
No special place shines

Ancient photons hum
cosmic microwave background
Baby cosmos speaks

Space swells in a blink
Quantum ripples stretch out far
inflation began

large-scale structure grows
Filaments lace dark matter
Clusters knot the void

Friedmann equations
Guide the scale factor's climb up
Cosmic math moves on

Distant lights drift red
Rubber heavens stretch apart
expansion speeds on

Hot soup cools to hush
Pairs stop meeting in the dark
freeze out locks relics

Galaxies whirl fast
Gravity needs extra mass
dark matter hides well

Ghosts of the weak force
They pass through worlds unharmed still
neutrinos slip through

Heat in early fields
B and L blur at high scales
sphalerons flip charge

Seeds in quiet soup
density perturbation
Grow to cosmic webs

Curvature looks gone
Why so close to zero now
flatness problem nags

Measure of stretching
Each tick multiplies distance
e-folds count the growth

After inflation
Fields decay, and light returns
reheating warms space

Distant galaxies
homogeneity hums
One hush over all

No direction wins
isotropy holds steady
Light spreads the same way

Afterglow still sings
cosmic microwave background
Cold quilt of the sky

Tiny ripples seed
inflation stretches space fast
Flat world, sudden calm

Night opens its book
Universe keeps time for us
We read by starlight

Gravity braids dust
large-scale structure emerges
Webs span darkened void

Friedmann equations
guide scale factor each epoch
Hubble beats like drums

Space between us grows
expansion pulls light red out
Distances breathe wide

First moment, no clock
big bang, then a hot hush bright
Time learns to unfold

Heat thins the chorus
freeze out leaves relics behind
Reactions go still

Galaxies turn slow
dark matter grips the light yet
Unseen mass, sure pull

High heat breaks the rules
sphalerons flip charges once
B leaks into L

Phase change cools fast down
Kibble mechanism sets
Defects freeze in place

Quantum noise becomes
density perturbation
Clumps grow into worlds

Curvature should bloom
flatness problem haunts early
Yet space stays so flat

Scale factor leaps up
e-folds count growth in logs now
Each round doubles space

Inflaton decays
reheating lights the plasma
Quanta wake again

Smooth fields share one face
homogeneity reigns
No clumps break the calm

Turn and the sky stays
isotropy everywhere
Directions agree

Ancient light still glows
cosmic microwave background
Cold echoes of birth

Tiny patch, vast fate
inflation stretches space fast
Ripples seed the stars

Galaxies gather
large-scale structure weaves through voids
Filaments whisper

Scale factor ascends
Friedmann equations guide us
Curvature counts time

Between all bright points
expansion widens night still
Redshift hums away

From nothing, a spark
big bang, the first hot note sung
Time learns to unfold

Numbers left in light
primordial abundance
Clues for dark ages

As heat thins to mist
freeze out locks relics in place
Rates fall silent too

Gravity feels more
dark matter in the dust deep
Hidden halos steer

Through Earth they ghost by
neutrinos hardly touch us
Solar whispers pass

Hot electroweak
sphalerons break B plus L
Asymmetry stays

Phase changes leave knots
Kibble mechanism sparks
Defects map the chill

Quantum seeds in fog
density perturbation
Grows to galaxy

Peccei-Quinn dream bright
axions softly sway in fields
Cold dark waves may sing

Curvature should show
flatness problem haunts us still
So close to zero

Count the doublings now
e-folds in inflation time
Log scales tell the tale

After rapid stretch
reheating floods the fields warm
Particles return

Afterglow of time
cosmic microwave background
traces young cosmos

We ride on photons
Universe keeps expanding
curved by silent laws

Curvature meets time
Friedmann equations steer us
space learns how to swell

Distant lights drift red
expansion pulls galaxies
and time marks the stretch

Invisible weight
dark matter bends the orbits
stars obey its pull

Matter wins by one
baryogenesis at dawn
so we can exist

Hot electroweak
sphalerons flip baryon counts
numbers can change sign

Broken symmetry
domain walls slice through vacuum
sheets in cosmic night

Tiny bumps in dawn
density perturbation
grow to galaxies

Curvature should grow
flatness problem haunts the math
yet it stays so close

After inflation
reheating warms the vacuum
heat returns to light

Space looks smooth to us
Pure homogeneity
until scales grow vast

No special axis
isotropy holds here still
sky whispers the same

From hot light to dust
Universe expands on time
we trace its old arc

Gravity weaves void
large-scale structure takes shape slow
clusters lace dark threads

Curvature, dust, light
Friedmann equations sing now
H from density

Far galaxies part
expansion reddens far light
space itself grows wide

Minutes after birth
primordial abundance
light elements stay

Rates fall below H
freeze out locks relic hearts tight
dark species drift on

Unseen mass bends paths
dark matter haunts halos still
keeps galaxies held

Electroweak foam
sphalerons flip B plus L
write asymmetry

Phase breaks, lines remain
cosmic strings thread the void deep
lensing sparks bright arcs

Quantum noise whispers
density perturbation
builds galaxy web

Omega near one
flatness problem asks why so
inflation smooths it

Scale factor explodes
e-folds count the growth of a
horizon slips out

Inflaton decays
reheating fills space with light
plasma sparks anew
